downloadTitle: Team Explorer for Microsoft Visual Studio 2012 Language Pack
downloadDescription: The Team Explorer for Visual Studio 2012 Language Pack is a free add-on that you can use to switch the language that's displayed in the Team Explorer user interface.
detailsSection: The Team Explorer Language Pack enables the display of some of the UI in different languages. After you install the Language Pack, you can switch among the languages. Team Explorer for Visual Studio 2012 must be installed before you can install the Language Pack.
systemRequirementsSection:
• Windows 7 SP1 (x86 and x64)
    • Windows 8 (x86 and x64)
    • Windows Server 2008 R2 SP1 (x64)
    • Windows Server 2012 (x64)
  • Hardware Requirements:
    • 1.6 GHz or faster processor
    • 1 GB of RAM (1.5 GB if running on a virtual machine)
    • 200 MB of available hard disk space
    • 5400 RPM hard drive
    • DirectX 9-capable video card running at 1024 x 768 or higher display resolution
installInstructionSection:
Note for RC users:  If you have an edition of Visual Studio 2012 RC installed, you can upgrade it to the release version. Before you upgrade, check the release notes for steps that might be required before you install the release version. Note: Cross-edition upgrades are not supported—for example, an upgrade from Visual Studio Premium 2012 RC to the release version of Visual Studio Ultimate 2012 is not supported, but an upgrade from Visual Studio Premium 2012 RC to the release version of Visual Studio Premium 2012 is supported.

This Language Pack is for Team Explorer for Visual Studio 2012 only, and has these pre-requisites:
  • Team Explorer must be installed before the Language Pack can be installed
  • The .NET Framework 4.5 Language Pack must be installed separately.
  1. On this page, choose the Download button.
    • To install the software now, choose the Run button.
    • To save the download to your computer so that you can install it later, choose the Save button.
additionalInformationSection: For important information about this release, see the Visual Studio 2012 Readme File
